[doc] Regenerate doco for 0.10.1.pre3
Inc version to 0.10.1.pre3
Bump all gem deps
Regenerate doco
[doc] Add refs to pandoc etc in ronn man pages

[doc] Fix some bad markup in `ronn.1.ronn` that was causing bad list rendering

Looks like the missing trailing colon (":") on one item in a definition list was causing the whole list to be mis-detected as a bullet list instead. This change fixes the rendering of the ronn.1 man page itself. But I think there should be an additional fix that has ronn issue a warning or error when it encounters a list with inconsistent item types and there's some ambiguity as to what type of list it is.

See: https://github.com/apjanke/ronn-ng/issues/94
Regenerate doco for 0.10.1.pre2
Manually inc version in lib/ronn.rb to "0.10.1.pre2"
Bump all gem deps
[doc] Update and https-ify links in documentation

Bump rack from 2.2.3.1 to 2.2.6.2

Bumps [rack](https://github.com/rack/rack) from 2.2.3.1 to 2.2.6.2.

...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
[doc] Add tnir and deivid-rodriguez to AUTHORS

Relax kramdown-parser-gfm dependency to 1.1.x

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>

Workaround for Psych 4.0+ in tests

Psych 4.0, shipped with Ruby 3.1, switched to a "safe load" by default, and requires you to explicitly set allowed classes. But previous Psych versions didn't support this kwarg, so the call needs to be made differently depending on which version of Psych/Ruby this is running under.

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>

Remove explicit "date = " from gemspec

Rubocop says this is set automatically:

ronn-ng.gemspec:4:3: C: [Correctable] Gemspec/DateAssignment: Do not use date = in gemspec, it is set automatically when the gem is packaged.
  s.date = '2020-12-22'
  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Migrate to GitHub Actions from Travis CI

Travis CI no longer has an "all you can eat" FLOSS offer, and all my credits are used up. Let's try GitHub Actions; it worked for the RubyGems folks with their nronn fork.

* https://github.com/apjanke/ronn-ng/issues/88
* https://github.com/n-ronn/nronn/pull/8

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>
Expand gem description

Fix bugs in `rake rev`

Thanks to tnir for the code, from the nronn fork at:
  * https://github.com/n-ronn/nronn/commit/a67c73dda146f9bc2d672f079e31219273b39e34
  * https://github.com/n-ronn/nronn/commit/653ad57efd06e801039c99893554082d89dbc0d6

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>
Bump deps: rubocop, rack, sinatra, nokogiri

Clean up gem, removing tests and gemfiles.

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>
Rename main git branch from "master" to "main"

Relax nokogiri dependency from 1.11.0 to 1.10.10, to support Ruby 2.4

This is required to support Ruby 2.4, because nokogiri 1.11.x requires Ruby 2.5. Update README to reflect Ruby version requirements.

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>
[doc] Changelog: Add note about 0.10.0 nonexistence

[doc] Rename doc-src/ to doc-project/

I view "doc-src" as source code for generated documentation, and "doc-project" as internal documentation about the project for use by developers. The stuff in here is internal developer doco. (This is Andrew's own naming convention, not a common or standard one.)
[doc] Markdown formatting fixes
[doc] Update copyright notices for new years

Use valid charset in Content-Type in HTML output

See ISO 10646:2017 etc.

Signed-off-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>
Merge!

'-i' is actually a less option. more is aliased to less on macOS, but not
on Linux, or at least not on all Linux systems.

I can't figure out why 'rake package' sometimes fails under Travis: it seems like it sometimes creates the gem file with the wrong version (not including the ".pre.SNAPSHOT") bit. This test isn't critical, so I'm just going to turn it off.

Merge pull request #51 from deivid-rodriguez/revert_bu_to_ci_change

Revert `\(bu` to `\[ci]` change

Revert "Merge pull request #71 from freeformsystems/master"

This reverts commit e7df1f0d254836f6ac7760a2727b4bd342d52ecb, reversing
changes made to c3fd67e94094e3e366e958d746c68c2903756294.

Commit was introduce as a aesthetic change when using `-Kutf8 -Tutf8`.

Quoting from the issue that led to the PR:

> This may seem a little strange, it's more aesthetic then anything
> else. When troff is run with -Kutf8 -Tutf8 to ensure that utf8
> characters appear correctly then the bullets generated by \(bu appear as
> small squares (I'm using 13pt Pragmata Pro).

However, in `bundler` we're not using `-Tutf8`, but `-Tascii`, and this
results in weird characters for list items as reported [here](https://github.com/cli-kit/cli-command/issues/78).

Since this change never made it into any `ronn` release, I think
reverting it could encourage adoption of `ronn-ng` as a drop-in
replacement of `ronn`. At least for us :)

Merge pull request #52 from deivid-rodriguez/fix_ci

Fix style issue
Fix style issue
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/apjanke/ronn-ng
code formatting

Merge pull request #46 from deivid-rodriguez/allow_mustache_1

Support only mustache 1.x
Support only mustache 1.x

Workaround for Psych 4.0+ in tests

Psych 4.0, shipped with Ruby 3.1, switched to a "safe load" by default, and requires you to explicitly set allowed classes. But previous Psych versions didn't support this kwarg, so the call needs to be made differently depending on which version of Psych/Ruby this is running under.

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>

Remove explicit "date = " from gemspec

Rubocop says this is set automatically:

ronn-ng.gemspec:4:3: C: [Correctable] Gemspec/DateAssignment: Do not use date = in gemspec, it is set automatically when the gem is packaged.
  s.date = '2020-12-22'
  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Migrate to GitHub Actions from Travis CI

Travis CI no longer has an "all you can eat" FLOSS offer, and all my credits are used up. Let's try GitHub Actions; it worked for the RubyGems folks with their nronn fork.

* https://github.com/apjanke/ronn-ng/issues/88
* https://github.com/n-ronn/nronn/pull/8

Co-authored-by: Takuya Noguchi <takninnovationresearch@gmail.com>

Revert "Merge pull request #71 from freeformsystems/master"

This reverts commit e7df1f0d254836f6ac7760a2727b4bd342d52ecb, reversing
changes made to c3fd67e94094e3e366e958d746c68c2903756294.

Commit was introduce as a aesthetic change when using `-Kutf8 -Tutf8`.

Quoting from the issue that led to the PR:

> This may seem a little strange, it's more aesthetic then anything
> else. When troff is run with -Kutf8 -Tutf8 to ensure that utf8
> characters appear correctly then the bullets generated by \(bu appear as
> small squares (I'm using 13pt Pragmata Pro).

However, in `bundler` we're not using `-Tutf8`, but `-Tascii`, and this
results in weird characters for list items as reported [here](https://github.com/cli-kit/cli-command/issues/78).

Since this change never made it into any `ronn` release, I think
reverting it could encourage adoption of `ronn-ng` as a drop-in
replacement of `ronn`. At least for us :)
